data.text:
The secular nationalist party Israel Beitenu (Israel Our Home), led by MP Avigdor Libeman, accused ultra-Orthodox legislators for the current political crisis and the impossibility of forming a government led by the Likud party.

This midnight ends the deadline to form a new government and there are only a few hours left.

MK Oded Forer of the Israel Beitenu party criticized the ultra-Orthodox Shas and United Torah Judaism parties, accusing them of bogging down coalition talks which could lead the country to new elections just weeks after the 21st election. Knesset (Parliament).

"Let's be clear, those who are blocking the formation of the government are the ultra-orthodox parties (haredim) that insist on poking their fingers in the eyes of the public who serve in the army and fulfill their obligations in the reserves," Forer said.

According to the deputy, the bill that was drafted in the previous Parliament (Knesset) was accepted by ultra-Orthodox legislators, who now simply reject the agreement - according to which Haredi deputies would leave the Knesset plenary session when the bill is voted on. of law, which will allow it to be approved.

“The compromise agreement under which they will not vote on [the bill] is reasonable, and the problems they are creating by sending Israel back to elections are their fault. "I suggest that Likud concentrate its pressure in the right direction, instead of pointing it at us."

Israel Beitenu is pushing for the passage of a military enlistment bill that will force rabbinical academies (yeshivos) to comply with enlistment quotas imposed by law.

Ultra-Orthodox lawmakers reject the proposal and instead call for an amendment to Israel's Basic Laws that would overturn the Supreme Court's opposition to the current system of postponing military enlistment.
